scenes.background: Monica and Bob look at you expectantly.
scenes.description: So, do you think we should always call for help immediately?

options.text: It depends on the situation. Some issues need immediate attention, others can wait.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the complexity of the situation, showing good perception and social skills, but motivation is slightly lower.

options.text: Immediate action can prevent bigger problems. It's better safe than sorry.
options.analysis: You justify taking immediate action, showing strong self-regulation and motivation, but perception and empathy could be improved.

options.text: Not always. Sometimes waiting is the best course of action.
options.analysis: You suggest a more cautious approach, showing good social skills but lower perception and empathy.
